title.narrative: EBRD Small Business Impact Fund (SBIF): VB & EaP
EBRD Small Business Impact Fund (SBIF): WB & EaP

description.narrative: Den europeiska utvecklingsbankens (EBRD) Small Business Impact Fund ger stöd till små och medelstora företag (SMEs) inom sysselsättning, bolagsstyrning, energieffektivisering, ökad konkurrenskraft och hållbar tillväxt. Genom fonden strävar EBRD efter att skapa ett effektivare partnerskap med givare i syfte att säkerställa en större och mer flexibel pool av medel för att investera i små och medelstora företag och därmed generera större effekt under bankens initiativ för stöd till småföretagare. Fonden syftar till (i) att mer effektivt strukturera efterfrågan på resurser i olika länder och regioner och (ii) att anslå medel mer strategiskt för produkter och aktiviteter.

The European Business Bank's EBRD Small Business Impact Fund provides support to SMEs in employment, corporate governance, energy efficiency, increased competitiveness and sustainable growth. Through the fund, the EBRD strives to create a more effective partnership with donors in order to ensure a larger and more flexible pool of funds to invest in small and medium-sized enterprises and thereby generate greater impact under the bank's initiatives to support small business owners. The fund aims to (i) to more efficiently structure the demand for resources in different countries and regions and (ii) to allocate funds more strategically for products and activities.
Distribution: No country allocations in advance.

The main objective of the SBIF remains unchanged ("Sustainable access to finance and advice for SMEs in Eastern Partnership and Western Balkans"). However, this agreement ammendment adds specific objectives, expected outputs and outcomes coupled to the trageted intervention at hand, see below (from Project Concept Note):

participating-org.narrative: EBRD/European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
EBRD/European Bank for Reconstruction and Development

tag.narrative: 8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

title.narrative: Agreement amendment 2020, Small Business Impact Fund
Agreement, Sida_EBRD, Small Business Impact Fund, 55030215
Decision on agreement amendment 2020, Small Business Impact Fund
Decision on contribution, Small Business Impact Fund, 55030215

description.narrative: As a result of the nature of the Small Business Impact Fund (SBIF), results of activities under the fund have previously mainly been considered on individual project-basis. However, for the first time, EBRD has now included a "Fund Report-Cover sheet" in the annual reporting for 2020, which tries to summarize the results from the SBIF on an aggregated level. This has been a request from several donors, Sida included, over the past years. While there is still a lot to be developed, this first attempt to aggregate results from the different initiatives and show more of impact level effects of the fund's operations should be considered a positive step in the right direction. Swedish funds continue to support spending under the Eastern Europe & South Caucasus and Western Balkans windows. During 2020, the fund has grown in size to EUR 51.6 million with fund commitments at 87%, translating to 22 of dedicated programmes. Central Asia and Eastern Europe & South Caucasus account for roughly one third each of the total allocation of funds within the SBIF, while Western Balkans account for 16.7%. On an aggregate level, initiatives under the SBIF has contributed to direct, co-financed or indirect financing to a total of 19 561 SMEs. 1116 SMEs have received advisory support, 735 consultants have been trained to support SMEs locally and USD 17 million has been provided to partner financial institutions for on-lending to women-led SMEs (mainly through the Women in business programs which are supported by Sweden thourgh separate contributions). 81% of SMEs reached report increases in turnover, one year after completion of advisory support. Finally, by the end of the reporting period, the SMEs supported through advisory services have given rise to 7052 new jobs. The EBRD has successfully been able to adapt activities in accordance with restrictions posed by the Covid-19 pandemic during 2020. In addition to making advisory services, networking activities and meetings digital, the content of business support has also been adjusted to better answer to entrepreneurs' demand for knowledge regarding digitalization, value chain management and "greening" of businesses. Sida contributed with an additional 1 MEUR in this regard to the Eastern Europe & South Caucasus window in 2020.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
